description:
In today's Daily Fix:

Respawn Entertainment's next Star Wars game might not be another Jedi Fallen Order game, but a first-person shooter starring a Mandalorian. Multiple sources have said that it won't be open-world like Ubisoft's upcoming Star Wars Outlaws, but a more linear affair and set during the time of the Empire, NOT during The Mandalorian TV series. In other news, Microsoft dropped a tiny nugget of info on their next hardware release during yesterday's Xbox business update podcast. They're claiming it will be the "largest technical leap you will have ever seen in a hardware generation," which doesn't mean much considering every new hardware cycle is always touted as a big technical leap from the last. But this could also be that mid-gen refresh that was strongly hinted at during the Microsoft-FCC trial. And finally, Super Smash Bros. father Masahiro Sakurai can now rest easy, as his work on SSB Ultimate is finally complete, with the release of the Sora Amiibo. Cong
title: Star Wars Mandalorian Shooter Reportedly In The Works At Respawn - IGN Daily Fix

description: Skull and Bones is available now on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, Amazon Luna, and PC. Get another look at the co-op open-world pirate action RPG in this latest trailer, including the reveal that a free trial of Skull and Bones is available now.
title: Skull and Bones - Official Free Trial Trailer

description:
Check out the launch trailer for Mario vs. Donkey Kong to see enemies, levels, puzzles, and more from this updated version of the Game Boy Advance game. Mario vs. Donkey Kong is available now on Nintendo Switch.

#IGN #Gaming #Nintendo
title: Mario vs. Donkey Kong - Official Launch Trailer

description: Watch the new trailer for Sonic Dream Team to see what to expect with the latest update, which brings time trials, new boss missions, and more to the platformer game. Sonic Dream Team is available now on Apple Arcade.
title: Sonic Dream Team - Official Content Update Trailer

description:
Watch the latest trailer for Dragon's Dogma 2 to see the Mage vocation in action from this upcoming action RPG. 

Wielding a staff, the Mage offers support to their party in various ways: from launching magick attacks, offering enchantments that bolster their party members’ weapons, to casting healing spells. The more advanced and powerful the magick is, the longer the incantation time will be. As a Mage, you will experience the strategic excitement of deftly executing your magick abilities.

Dragon's Dogma 2 will be available on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and Steam on March 22, 2024.

#IGN #Gaming #DragonsDogma2
title: Dragon's Dogma 2 - Official Mage Vocation Trailer
Here's how to craft your ship in Skull and Bones! Presented by Skull and Bones - A @Ubisoft Original

description:
Get a closer look at Ed's abilities, moves, and how to play as the character in this latest trailer for Street Fighter 6. Warm up for a masterclass in boxing. Ed's gameplan revolves around his quick flickers and long reach to keep opponents on the defensive.

Owners of the Deluxe and Ultimate Edition or the Year 1 Character Pass and Ultimate Pass of Street Fighter 6 will obtain Ed when he releases on February 27, 2024.
title: Street Fighter 6 - Official Ed Overview Trailer

description:
Here's your look at gameplay from Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot's upcoming Goku Next Journey DLC. Get ready to fight against Goten as Goku (Blue Gi) in the Dragon Ball Z: Kararot: Goku's Next Journey DLC, available in February 2024.

#IGN #gaming #dragonballzkakarot
title: Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot - Official Goku's Next Journey DLC Gameplay Trailer

description:
This week on Next-Gen Console Watch, Daemon is joined by Beyond's Max Scoville and Podcast Unlocked's Ryan McCaffrey as they break down the recent Xbox Business Update podcast. Rumors have been swirling that Microsoft will finally let major first-party Xbox games onto competing consoles, and Xbox's communication of their business plans have been lacking as of late. Will we get Halo on PlayStation 5? Sea of Thieves on Nintendo Switch? What about Indiana Jones and the Great Circle, or Starfield? Plus we go over last week's poll, and have a brand new poll for you to vote on at IGN.com.

#IGN #Gaming #Xbox
title: Xbox's Exclusivity Changes Aren't So Big After All - Next-Gen Console Watch

description:
The Grand Theft Auto series has always built itself on humour, being a blunt satire of the USA, but with players returning to Vice City - Rockstars very own Miami, Florida hybrid - how do you satirise America in the 2020s? With the recent GTA 6 trailer, you just need to hold up a mirror.

From Florida Joker, to car roof twerking Floridians, and conservative pro-gun loving governors like Ron DeSantis, Rockstar Games' comedic commentary has a lot to work with when standing up to the ugliest corners of American society.

The GTA 6 release date is 2025 on PS5 and Xbox Series X/S.

For more on Grand Theft Auto VI, check out our 99 Details From the GTA 6 Trailer, and GTA VI Trailer Reaction video: https://youtu.be/bMq4OtZTigk & https://youtu.be/PuMSEkVqC9k

#IGN #GTA #GTA6
title: In GTA 6, Florida Will Write The Jokes Itself

description:
Foamstars reviewed by Charlie Wacholz on PlayStation 5, also available on PlayStation 4.

"Foamstars is at odds with itself. Its unexpectedly engaging combat mechanics, fast-paced matches, and cool music draw me in, but trudging through its flat single-player content, concerningly aggressive monetization, and horrendously slow menus has numbered Foamstars’ days on my PS5 hard drive. I also feel like I’ve already seen everything it has to offer, and its announced update plan looks glacially slow for a sink-or-swim multiplayer landscape currently full of great options. Foamstars’ ranked modes and maps may be exciting and nuanced mid-match, but the confounding time-gated queues around them don’t offer much motivation to grind up the ladder, which leaves me with very little reason to surf these bubbly waves no matter how much fun it may be."
title: Foamstars Video Review

description:
If there’s one thing we’ve learned from Helldivers 2, it’s that the swarms of bugs and rampaging robots putting Super Earth at risk need a big dose of lead-wrapped-democracy! We’ve put together these 13 essential tips to help you stay alive and inflict the kind of freedom these monstrosities so desperately deserve.

#IGN #Gaming #Helldivers2
title: Helldivers 2: 13 Essential Tips to Help You Spread Democracy

description: A lot was revealed in the latest Xbox podcast, where Phil Spencer, Sarah Bond and Matt Booty discussed the future of its platform and its plans on embracing third-parties in regards to publishing. While he didn’t name those four games, he did quell the rumors of if either Starfield or the upcoming Indiana Jones game are among those four with a no. Exclusivity is something that those who own one console or the other take stock in and somewhat pride in when heralding their respective console of choice. Well, you gotta look at it from a business perspective, and the latest Xbox Wire post lays out the reasoning in clear terms: “To ensure long-term success for both Xbox and the industry as a whole, we must continue to evolve. Today we announced that we will expand the communities we reach: we are currently in the process of bringing four Xbox games to other platforms.” So there you have it; it’s to make sure #Xbox continues to thrive in the gaming market, and pretty much grow its
title: Xbox Console Exclusives Confirmed For PS5 and Nintendo Switch - IGN Daily Fix

description:
Skull and Bones can be a lot to tackle when you first embark on your sea-dog journey. With so many ports, materials, and customization options, it can be difficult to get your sea legs. In this guide, we will discuss some helpful tips and tricks to get you plundering and pillaging ships in no time in Skull and Bones.

#IGN #Gaming
title: Skull and Bones: 7 Essential Tips For Pirate Domination
